snippet: The demonstrations reflected concerns that the new chief executive, Leung Chun-ying, may roll back some of the city’s cherished civil liberties.
abstract: Pro-democracy demonstrators throng the streets of Hong Kong hours after Leung Chun-ying is sworn in as chief executive; activists worry that Leung's sympathies for the Chinese Communist Party may lead him to roll back some of the city's cherished civil liberties, although Leung has denied that.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and KEVIN DREW
byline.contributor:
Hilda Wang and Jacob Fromer
contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The demonstrations reflected concerns that the new chief executive, Leung Chun-ying, may roll back some of the city’s cherished civil liberties.

headline.main: Protesters March as New Hong Kong Leader Is Sworn In
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Sees Protest As Leader Is Sworn In
